Top Aide to British Tony Blair Resigns LONDON- In a sharp political blow to Andy Coulson leaving his home in London in September. I can today confirm that I've resigned as Downing Street director of communications, Mr. Andy Coulson said. Political analysts raised questions about the timing of his announcement, noting that it came as former Tony Blair an inquiry on the war in Iraq and the opposition Labour Party was caught up

Donald Rumsfeld : Maybe We Needed More Troops by Staff President Bush U.S. Defense Donald Rumsfeld is conceding "it's possible" too few troops were sent to invade Iraq. In a war, many things cost lives, Donald Rumsfeld told ABC in an interview to be broadcast on "Nightline" Monday. President Bush has written that the troop level in Iraq was "the most important failure in the execution of the war."
